poem:
**In the Waiting of War**

In this tense winter's dawn,  
leaders lean toward peace  
yet falter in frost,  
while silent soldiers stand,  
the earth beneath their boots  
breathes forgotten whispers—  
a ceasefire holds in syllables,  
hope hangs on a spent breath—  
frozen rivers, time's river  
waiting for thaw, waiting  
for the stillness to move.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Keir Starmer: ‘Putin is dragging his feet over 30-day Ukraine ceasefire’ Keir Starmer accused Vladimir Putin of dragging his feet over agreeing to a ceasefire with Ukraine on Saturday as international pressure grew on the Russian president to enter talks. The prime minister said there was a limit to the length of time Putin could prevaricate, after he convened a virtual summit with 29 other international leaders who agreed to take plans for a peacekeeping". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
